info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 11 at 3:10PM MST until April 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... reissued for Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 307 PM MST, cameras positioned around Red Lake continue to indicate dust originating from the dry lake bed. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Pierce Ferry Road and Anteras Road. Locations impacted include... Grand Canyon Ranch, Grand Canyon Skywalk, Diamond Creek Campground, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Meadview and Lake Mead National Recreation Area. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Las Vegas.
